alert.note: Alert for Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 1:06PM CDT until April 16 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR RAPID SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FOR THE POTATO RIVER AND TYLER FORKS RIVER UNTIL 4 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rapid snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Northern Iron County in northwest Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Potato River and Tyler Forks River, along with other area creeks, and low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1253 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Part of US Highway 2 near Lakehead Road near Kimball may continue to have water over it. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hurley, Saxon, Gurney, Upson, Gile, Montreal, Kimball, Pence, Iron Belt, Cedar, Gile Flowage and Bad River Reservation. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.
